title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 333/81 of 4 February 1981 on the classification of goods under Common Customs Tariff heading No 64.01
header:
COMMISSION REGULATION (EEC) No 333/81 of 4 February 1981 on the classification of goods under Common Customs Tariff heading No 64.01
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: Boots of which the outer sole and the lower part of the upper, which almost entirely covers the foot, are of rubber, and of which the top part of the upper, which covers the lower leg but does not extend beyond mid-calf, is of leather and has metal eyelets for laces, shall be classified in the Common Customs Tariff under heading: 64.01 Footwear with outer soles and uppers of rubber or artificial plastic material.

This Regulation shall enter into force on the 21st day following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 4 February 1981.
For the Commission
Karl-Heinz NARJES
Member of the Commission
(1) OJ No L 14, 21.1.1969, p. 1.  (2) OJ No L 40, 11.2.1977, p. 1.  (3) OJ No L 172, 22.7.1968, p. 1.  (4) OJ No L 315, 14.11.1980, p. 1.
